title: torch ModuleNotFoundError in ipython
body_html:
Hi,

I installed pytorch from source using anacoda3 but ipython does not seem to be able to import the torch module somehow.

(pytorch) pedro@hal9000:~/workspace$ ls
benchmarks
(pytorch) pedro@hal9000:~/workspace$ python 
Python 3.6.0 |Continuum Analytics, Inc.| (default, Dec 23 2016, 12:22:00) 
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-1)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.1.9+0720ba5'
>>> 
(pytorch) pedro@hal9000:~/workspace$ ipython
Python 3.6.0 |Anaconda 4.3.0 (64-bit)| (default, Dec 23 2016, 12:22:00) 
Type "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

IPython 5.1.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python.
?         -> Introduction and overview of IPython's features.
%quickref -> Quick reference.
help      -> Python's own help system.
object?   -> Details about 'object', use 'object??' for extra details.

In [1]: import torch
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ModuleNotFoundError                       Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-c031d3dd82fc> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'torch'

In [2]:

Any ideas?

Thanks

body:
Hi,

I installed pytorch from source using anacoda3 but ipython does not seem to be able to import the torch module somehow. 

```
(pytorch) pedro@hal9000:~/workspace$ ls
benchmarks
(pytorch) pedro@hal9000:~/workspace$ python 
Python 3.6.0 |Continuum Analytics, Inc.| (default, Dec 23 2016, 12:22:00) 
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-1)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.1.9+0720ba5'
>>> 
(pytorch) pedro@hal9000:~/workspace$ ipython
Python 3.6.0 |Anaconda 4.3.0 (64-bit)| (default, Dec 23 2016, 12:22:00) 
Type "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

IPython 5.1.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python.
?         -> Introduction and overview of IPython's features.
%quickref -> Quick reference.
help      -> Python's own help system.
object?   -> Details about 'object', use 'object??' for extra details.

In [1]: import torch
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ModuleNotFoundError                       Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-c031d3dd82fc> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'torch'

In [2]: 
```
Any ideas? 

Thanks
